Solar power is a renewable energy source that uses sunlight to generate electricity. It is considered one of the cleanest and most abundant sources of energy available.

Solar power works through the use of photovoltaic (PV) cells or solar panels. These panels contain several layers of semiconducting materials that absorb sunlight and convert it into direct current (DC) electricity. An inverter is then used to convert the DC electricity into alternating current (AC) electricity, which can be used to power homes, businesses, and even cities.

One of the major advantages of solar power is its environmental friendliness. It produces no greenhouse gas emissions during operation, helping to reduce our carbon footprint and combat climate change. Additionally, solar energy is a free and renewable resource, as sunlight is constantly available.

Solar panels can be installed on rooftops, in solar farms, or even integrated into buildings and infrastructure.
